newsitem.title: USA: Lernout & Hauspie, Microsoft in pact.
newsitem.headline: Lernout & Hauspie, Microsoft in pact.

text.p: Lernout & Hauspie Speech Products NV said Monday it has licensed its automatic speech recognition and text-to-speech software to Microsoft Corp to embed into its future products.

The company's text-to-speech technology enables electronic equipment to convert written text to "human-like" speech. The product is available in seven languages including both American and British English, Dutch, French, German, Italian, Korean and Spanish.
Arabic, Mandarin Chinese, Japanese and Portuguese are now under development, it said.

"We are of course extremely pleased with Microsoft's decision to license our ASR and TTS technology," said Gaston Bastiaens, president of Lernout & Hauspie, referring to the automatic speech recognition and text-to-speech software.

"The fact that our technologies will be extensively used throughout the software development community clearly indicates that speech recognition is becoming ... more widely accepted," said Bastiaens, the former chief executive of Quarterdeck Corp.
The company's worldwide headquarters is in Ieper, Belgium, and U.S. headquarters is located in Burlington, Mass.
